repository.corpname: Washington State University Libraries, Manuscripts, Archives and Special Collections

origination.corpname: Washington State University. Student Health Service

did.unittitle: Preliminary Guide to the Washington State University Student Health Service Records
did.abstract: Journals detailing medical care on the WSU campus from 1916 to 1960.

bioghist.p: WSU's Student Health dates to the earliest days of campus, and ran through a small medical facility known as Maple Cottage and then through the hospital building on campus (Finch Memorial, later the Washington Building).

scopecontent.p: The collections consists of six day journals detailing instances of medical care at the WSU medical facility. The six volumes cover Dec. 1928 - Jan. 1930, Sept. 1931 - Jun. 1932, Sept. 1932 - Jun. 1933, Nov. 1935 - Apr. 1936, May 1941 - Dec. 1941, and Dec. 1947 - Mar. 1960. There are additional loose materials, dating from 1916, 1932-1933, and undated, all sitting in the front of the first volume.

arrangement.p: This is an unprocessed collection. Any arrangement reflects either a pre-existing order from the records' creators or previous custodians, or preliminary sorting performed by staff.
The journals are each primarily in chronological order.

accessrestrict.p: These records are closed; no public access is allowed without consent and supervision of the archivist. No reproduction of materials is permitted.

userestrict.p: These records may not be reproduced in any form.

prefercite.p: Preliminary Guide to the Washington State University Student Health Service Records, 1916-1960 (UA1989-23)
Manuscripts, Archives, and Special Collections, Washington State University Libraries, Pullman, WA.

acqinfo.p: This material was transferred to WSU Libraries' MASC by Rita Walker of the Student Health Service on August 04, 1989 and retained as UA1989-23.

controlaccess.p: This collection is indexed under the following headings in the online catalog. Researchers desiring materials about related topics, persons, or places should search the catalog using these headings.
